posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.54.0-beta.1. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • A smile is the same in any language, but now that the emoji shortcuts in Signal Desktop have been fully translated you can also :smile: or :sourire: or :ÂæÆÁ¨ë: in any supported language too.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.53.0-beta.1‚Ä¶v7.54.0-beta.1 ¬∑ signalapp/Signal-Desktop ¬∑ GitHub

New Version: 7.54.0-beta.1

34 new commits since 7.53.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.54.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Update feature flag setup for funPicker [2]

  • Use libsignal key types internally [3]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.70.0 [4]

  • Improve validation of username searches [5]

  • Calling: Move VideoSupport.ts to Client [6]

  • Fix copy of emoji from message bubble [7]

  • Simplify conflict resolution in storage service [8]

  • Logging improvements for sessions [9]

  • Release notes UI fixes [10]

  • Fix ConverationHero Title for 1:1 Conversations [11]

  • Provisioner improvements [12]

  • Update strings [13]

  • Update DNS fallback [14]

  • Update staged link preview styles [15]

  • Fix link previews in forward modal [16]

  • Delay provisioner socket connection [17]

  • Send window activation from tray icon as well [18]

  • Simplify service id checks in MessageReceiver [19]

  • Fix some backup export issues [20]

  • Translate emoji completions in composer [21]

  • Additional fixes for backup validator [22]

  • Add tooltips to fun picker [23]

  • Update @signalapp/sqlcipher to 2.0.1 [24]

  • Username search: Trim leading/trailing whitespace beforehand [25]

  • Manually hoist all eslint config and plugin modules [26]

  • Shutdown: Don't hang up ringing incoming calls [27]

  • Set CI=true in reproducible build [28]

  • Reset expire timer version after unlink [29]

  • Fix localized emoji auto-completions [30]

  • Update README for reproducible-builds [31]

  • Update release notes [32]

  • Update strings [33]

  • 7.54.0-beta.1 [34]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.53.0-beta.1‚Ä¶v7.54.0-beta.1

Localization changes

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
I sent a GIF, which sent and displayed as expected, but then it stopped showing the GIF and now just says ‚Äúgif.mp4‚Äù. I don‚Äôt have good repro steps, but I remember changing the window focus away and then back to Desktop.

Log

This text will be hidden

Perhaps this is related?

Sudden issue with gifs Android Support
I use swiftkey keyboard, and it has it‚Äôs own gif selector (from Tenor). It used to function just like Signal‚Äôs built in gif-selector, where you would choose the image and then it would show the gif, and have the space to type an attached message before you send it off. Now it just sends the gif instantly when I select the gif. I don‚Äôt think it is the Swiftkey keyboard, as this function works the same as it used to in other messaging apps. Did anything change in Signal recently that might cau‚Ä¶

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
Could you provide a screenshot of it saying ‚Äúgif.mp4‚Äù? Wondering which specific attachment component it is using which would give me some hints as to what is going on.

What about your other devices, does your primary ios/android device show the gif?

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: It all displayed normally on mobile (Android). I‚Äôve unfortunately rebooted since reporting this, but I‚Äôll check and take a screenshot if it‚Äôs still there when I‚Äôm back on that computer.
